headline: Travelers Companies (NYSE:TRV) Reports Lower Q1 Earnings, Increases Dividend by 5%
summary: Travelers Companies (NYSE:TRV) announced a 5% increase in their regular quarterly dividend and released their Q1 2025 earnings report, which revealed declining net income and EPS compared to the previous year. Despite these mixed results, the company's stock posted a 5.6% gain over the past week. In a broader context, this price move aligns with the overall positive market trend, where equities have gained ground, despite setbacks in technology and trade-related sectors. The Travelers'...

headline: Travelers stock pops, Lockheed Martin upgrade, JB Hunt earnings
summary: US stocks (^GSPC, ^IXIC, ^DJI) slipped as a drop in Nvidia (NVDA) shares weighed heavily on the tech sector. The Travelers Companies (TRV) shares popped after reporting a first quarter earnings beat. Lockheed Martin (LMT) shares rose after Morgan Stanley upgraded the stock and raised its price target.  Meanwhile, J.B. Hunt Transport (JBHT) shares fell despite a first quarter earnings beat.  Stay up to date on the latest market action, minute-by-minute, with Yahoo Finance's Market Minute.

headline: Citizens earnings, Travelers stock pops: Trending tickers
summary: Wealth Host Brad Smith, joined Madison Mills, takes a closer look at some of the trending tickers during the trading day. Citizens Financial Group (CFG) reported net interest income and revenue that were in line with estimates as the firm beat on earnings. Travelers (TRV) reported a profit beat, with core earnings per share (EPS) coming in at $1.91, compared to estimates of $0.75. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Wealth here.

headline: Travelers Reports First Quarter Net Income of $395 Million and Core Income of $443 Million
summary: NEW YORK, April 16, 2025--The Travelers Companies, Inc. today reported net income of $395 million, or $1.70 per diluted share, for the quarter ended March 31, 2025, compared to $1.123 billion, or $4.80 per diluted share, in the prior year quarter. Core income in the current quarter was $443 million, or $1.91 per diluted share, compared to $1.096 billion, or $4.69 per diluted share, in the prior year quarter. Core income decreased primarily due to higher catastrophe losses, partially offset by a
